venue.name: Scullers Jazz Club @ The Doubletree Guest Suites

item.description:
"10 piece ensemble Ritmo Masacote delivers its phenomenal presentation, Fantagious!"
-- Kevin Ball (WGBH 89.7 Boston)

FANTAGIOUS
A Concert & Dinner Show presented by
Joel "Masacote" Massicot

Featuring Joel's ALL STAR Ritmo Masacote

GRAMMY Winner Pablo Chino Nunez of NYC (Timbales)
Panagiotis Andreou of NYC (Bass)
Pablo Bencid (Drums)
Tim Mayor (Tenor Saxophone)
Paulo Stagnaro (Bongos)
Jesus Andujar (Congas)
Michel Gonzalez (Guitar)
....and More!...

Tuesday, November 18, 2008
Show: $25
Dinner & Show: $70
Showtime: 8pm

Join us for a very special night of music on the same stage that's been graced by legends such as Eddie Palmieri and Larry Harlow.

Tickets are now available online! Capacity is limited to 150. Let's pack the place! Purchase tickets at: http://www.scullersja...

OR! Signup below with only a 1.50 paypal booking fee
*************************
Latin Jazz pianist extraordinaire Joel Massicot & his 10 piece ensemble Ritmo Masacote deliver their phenomenal music presentation, Fantagious (a combination of fantasy & contagious). "Ritmo Masacote's gift is obvious from the first downbeat you hear...Irresistible, Toe-Tapping, Hip, & Head-Shakingly Groovy!" -- Kevin Ball (WGBH 89.7, Boston)

Garnering rave reviews from the media, Fantagious leads us into a world of funky arrangements and original compositions that keep listeners moving until the last number. The band manages to tastefully challenge the traditional approach to Latin Jazz with an infusion of R&B and Caribbean nuances. The melodies and montunos are hip and illustrate how Latin Music is beginning to evolve...and evolution is what Fantagious is all about.

"Original scores are balanced with jazz standards such as Herbie Hancock's Maiden Voyage and Paul Desmond's Take Five, brilliantly arranged into the Ritmo Masacote-style of sounds and dance forms." -- Latin Beat Magazine

On board with the band are Grammy-winning NYC percussionist Pablo "Chino" Nu√±ez, NYC bassist Panagiotis Andreou, and a slew of Boston's finest led by musical director Joel "Masacote" Massicot. "It is bassist/vocalist Panagiotis Andreou who is the real wild card here, and bless Masacote for allowing Andreou to bring a new sensibility to the proceedings...Andreou really shines on a trio of Middle-Eastern and Greek tinged tracks." -- Pablo Yglesias, Descarga.com

It is no surprise that with this outstanding cast of musicians, Fantagious is full of flavor and swing. Joel Masacote shows his maturity in all aspects of this production, going above and beyond any set expectations. Joel's keen awareness about the relationship between the music & dance as well as their application through his compositions & arrangements have earned him instant recognition as a pioneer in the evolution of Latin Music.
item.how_to_find_us: I'll be the lady walking around with cds :)

group.name: The Boston & Cambridge Salsa Meetup Group

item.name: "Fantagious" Latin Jazz Dinner Concert @ Skullers Jazz Club!
